Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Describe their personal characteristics and those of others, and explain how they contribute to developing identities

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Describe their personal characteristics and those of others, and explain how they contribute to developing identities
Elaboration: Describing how people who identify as Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander have a unique cultural identity and how the contributions from family influence this (MH, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Describe their personal characteristics and those of others, and explain how they contribute to developing identities
Elaboration: Exploring examples of cultural practices, including those of Australians of Asian heritage, that recognise the contributions of family and friends to identities (MH, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Describe their personal characteristics and those of others, and explain how they contribute to developing identities
Elaboration: Identifying the benefits of having people with diverse skills and abilities in a team or classroom (MH, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Describe their personal characteristics and those of others, and explain how they contribute to developing identities
Elaboration: Participating in games and physical activities and describing how their own and others’ personal skills and abilities contribute to successful engagement in groups (AP, MH)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Describe their personal characteristics and those of others, and explain how they contribute to developing identities
Elaboration: Describing personal achievements and sharing how they felt and how these influenced their personal identities (MH)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Describe physical and social changes that occur as children grow older and discuss how family and community acknowledge these
Elaboration: Describing changes in their physical appearance now compared to when they were younger (RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Describe physical and social changes that occur as children grow older and discuss how family and community acknowledge these
Elaboration: Identifying and describing significant relationships in their lives and how these have evolved or changed over time (RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Describe physical and social changes that occur as children grow older and discuss how family and community acknowledge these
Elaboration: Identifying friendships and how they are similar or different to when they were younger, such as when they were in kindergarten (RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Describe physical and social changes that occur as children grow older and discuss how family and community acknowledge these
Elaboration: Discussing ways families and cultural groups acknowledge and celebrate major stages of development (RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Describe physical and social changes that occur as children grow older and discuss how family and community acknowledge these
Elaboration: Discussing tasks they are allowed to do by themselves and explaining how these have changed since they were younger (RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Identify and explore personal and social skills and strategies to develop respectful relationships
Elaboration: Identifying characters in texts (fictional and non-fictional) who demonstrate respect and cooperation to develop respectful relationships (RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Identify and explore personal and social skills and strategies to develop respectful relationships
Elaboration: Identifying characters in texts who demonstrate respect for different types of families and carers, including those of different cultures, abilities or compositions (RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Identify and explore personal and social skills and strategies to develop respectful relationships
Elaboration: Discussing strategies we can use to show respect to people of different cultures, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples, and to acknowledge difference using appropriate language (MH, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Identify and explore personal and social skills and strategies to develop respectful relationships
Elaboration: Describing behaviours that keep themselves and others safe and help them feel respected, including the use of appropriate verbal and body language and physical behaviours (MH, RS, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Identify and explore personal and social skills and strategies to develop respectful relationships
Elaboration: Exploring strategies to understand and manage bullying behaviours (MH, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Identify and explore personal and social skills and strategies to develop respectful relationships
Elaboration: Exploring how people feel when they are included in and when they are excluded from groups and activities (AP, MH, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Identify how different situations influence emotional responses
Elaboration: Recognising their own emotions and demonstrating ways to manage how they express their emotions in different situations (MH, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Identify how different situations influence emotional responses
Elaboration: Exploring self-regulation strategies to manage emotional responses, such as balloon breathing, counting down from 10 and mindfulness (MH, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Identify how different situations influence emotional responses
Elaboration: Identifying situations that may trigger strong emotional responses in themselves and others, and recognising the impact these responses can have on others (MH, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Identify how different situations influence emotional responses
Elaboration: Identifying how someone might feel, think and act during an emergency through role-play and imaginative play (MH, RS, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Identify how different situations influence emotional responses
Elaboration: Predicting how a person or character in a story might be feeling based on the words they use, their facial expressions and body language (RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Identify how different situations influence emotional responses
Elaboration: Recognising positive emotions in themselves and others and exploring different ways people express these emotions (MH, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Practise strategies they can use when they need to seek, give or deny permission respectfully
Elaboration: Practising strategies they can use when they need to give or refuse consent; for example, saying yes and no in an assertive manner, using non-verbal body cues and gestures (MH, RS, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Practise strategies they can use when they need to seek, give or deny permission respectfully
Elaboration: Practising ways to interact with others in a fair and respectful way in play and other activities, regardless of differences in gender, abilities, race or personality (RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Practise strategies they can use when they need to seek, give or deny permission respectfully
Elaboration: Exploring situations where they need to seek, give or deny permission and practising strategies to assert themselves; for example, saying no to inappropriate touching (MH, RS, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Identify and demonstrate protective behaviours and help-seeking strategies they can use to help them and others stay safe
Elaboration: Identifying the body’s reaction to a range of situations, including safe and unsafe situations, and comparing the different emotional responses (MH, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Identify and demonstrate protective behaviours and help-seeking strategies they can use to help them and others stay safe
Elaboration: Discussing the importance of seeking help when problems are too big to solve by themselves (MH, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Identify and demonstrate protective behaviours and help-seeking strategies they can use to help them and others stay safe
Elaboration: Identifying and rehearsing strategies they can use when requiring assistance, such as asking an adult they trust, reading basic signs to identify safe places, calling triple zero, locating services or local organisations they can contact in case of emergency and solving a problem with friends (S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Identify and demonstrate protective behaviours and help-seeking strategies they can use to help them and others stay safe
Elaboration: Exploring and planning strategies they can use at school and at home that promote safe use of digital tools (MH, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Identify and demonstrate protective behaviours and help-seeking strategies they can use to help them and others stay safe
Elaboration: Recognising photos and locations of safe places and a network of people who can help, and identifying a list of those in their network (RS, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Identify and demonstrate protective behaviours and help-seeking strategies they can use to help them and others stay safe
Elaboration: Explaining how characters in texts use protective behaviours and help-seeking strategies to keep themselves and others safe (MH, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate a range of health messages and strategies in their community to promote their own health, safety and wellbeing
Elaboration: Identifying poison labels and medicine packaging and understanding why it is important to ask an adult before taking medicines (AD, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate a range of health messages and strategies in their community to promote their own health, safety and wellbeing
Elaboration: Exploring sustainable practices that students can implement at school to improve the health and wellbeing of the class, such as composting food waste, creating an edible garden and reducing single-use plastics (FN)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate a range of health messages and strategies in their community to promote their own health, safety and wellbeing
Elaboration: Identifying and explaining different safety signs and symbols in their community, such as water safety and road safety signs and messages (S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate a range of health messages and strategies in their community to promote their own health, safety and wellbeing
Elaboration: Investigating health messages they receive from school, home and the community and discussing how these messages keep them safe and help them make better health and wellbeing decisions, such as dental hygiene, sun safety, appropriate use of digital technology and road safety (S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate a range of health messages and strategies in their community to promote their own health, safety and wellbeing
Elaboration: Identifying different types of advertising that influence choices about food (FN)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Practise fundamental movement skills and apply them in a variety of movement situations, including indoor, outdoor and aquatic settings
Elaboration: Performing locomotor movements using different body parts to travel in different directions (AP, CA, FMS, RE)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Practise fundamental movement skills and apply them in a variety of movement situations, including indoor, outdoor and aquatic settings
Elaboration: Selecting and implementing different movement skills to be successful in a range of games and movement situations, such as an obstacle course (AP, CA, FMS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Practise fundamental movement skills and apply them in a variety of movement situations, including indoor, outdoor and aquatic settings
Elaboration: Performing fundamental movement skills to control objects with equipment and different parts of the body (AP, FMS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Practise fundamental movement skills and apply them in a variety of movement situations, including indoor, outdoor and aquatic settings
Elaboration: Practising gliding forwards and backwards in the water using arm and kicking movements (FMS, LLPA, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Practise fundamental movement skills and apply them in a variety of movement situations, including indoor, outdoor and aquatic settings
Elaboration: Demonstrating balances and describing what helps to maintain stable positions (AP, FMS, RE)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate different ways of moving their body and manipulating objects and space, and draw conclusions about their effectiveness
Elaboration: Demonstrating changes in speed, direction and level as they use locomotor and non-locomotor skills in sequences (AP, FMS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate different ways of moving their body and manipulating objects and space, and draw conclusions about their effectiveness
Elaboration: Inventing new games, based on rules and equipment from familiar games, and drawing conclusions about whether the rules and choice of equipment provide for an interesting, challenging and enjoyable game (AP, FMS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate different ways of moving their body and manipulating objects and space, and draw conclusions about their effectiveness
Elaboration: Using stimuli such as equipment, rhythm, music and words to create simple playground games and assessing which games they enjoy most (AP, FMS, RE)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate different ways of moving their body and manipulating objects and space, and draw conclusions about their effectiveness
Elaboration: Using different equipment or skills to solve a movement challenge and explaining why particular equipment or skills were more successful to solve the challenge (AP, FMS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate different ways of moving their body and manipulating objects and space, and draw conclusions about their effectiveness
Elaboration: Participating in activities that require students to move around different outdoor spaces and discussing which types of movement are most appropriate to move around safely and efficiently (AP, CA, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate different ways of moving their body and manipulating objects and space, and draw conclusions about their effectiveness
Elaboration: Comparing different types of movements with and without equipment and identifying which ones are easier and harder and why this might be the case (AP, FMS, RE)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Participate in a range of physical activities in outdoor environments and aquatic settings and investigate contextual factors and environments that make physical activity safe and enjoyable
Elaboration: Participating in traditional Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples’ games and discussing how these games have similar origins to games they have previously experienced (AP, FMS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Participate in a range of physical activities in outdoor environments and aquatic settings and investigate contextual factors and environments that make physical activity safe and enjoyable
Elaboration: Recognising the physical features in a range of different environments, including outdoor environments, that make physical activity in these spaces enjoyable, such as play equipment and spaces for imaginative play (AP, CA, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Participate in a range of physical activities in outdoor environments and aquatic settings and investigate contextual factors and environments that make physical activity safe and enjoyable
Elaboration: Participating safely in physical activities in outdoor and aquatic environments within the school or local community and explaining the benefits of being physically active in these environments (AP, CA, FMS, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Participate in a range of physical activities in outdoor environments and aquatic settings and investigate contextual factors and environments that make physical activity safe and enjoyable
Elaboration: Participating in a range of minor games and discussing what makes them enjoyable (AP, FMS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Participate in a range of physical activities in outdoor environments and aquatic settings and investigate contextual factors and environments that make physical activity safe and enjoyable
Elaboration: Comparing the characteristics and benefits of physical activities that take place in an outdoor environment to those that take place inside (AP, CA, FMS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Co-construct and apply rules to promote fair play and inclusion in a range of physical activities
Elaboration: Discussing what is fair and unfair when developing rules and co-constructing a set of rules that are fair and inclusive for all (AP, FMS, RS, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Co-construct and apply rules to promote fair play and inclusion in a range of physical activities
Elaboration: Discussing changes to rules that will make an activity fairer or more inclusive of all learners (AP, FMS, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Co-construct and apply rules to promote fair play and inclusion in a range of physical activities
Elaboration: Explaining how rules contribute to fair play and applying them in group activities (AP, FMS, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Co-construct and apply rules to promote fair play and inclusion in a range of physical activities
Elaboration: Creating or adapting a game with others and co-constructing rules that make the game fun, safe, fair and inclusive (AP, FMS, RS, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Apply strategies to work cooperatively when participating in physical activities
Elaboration: Working cooperatively with a partner when practising new skills (AP, CA, FMS, RE)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Apply strategies to work cooperatively when participating in physical activities
Elaboration: Suggesting and trialling how a game can be changed so that everyone can be involved (AP, RS, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Apply strategies to work cooperatively when participating in physical activities
Elaboration: Demonstrating appropriate language (including verbal and non-verbal language, body language and gestures) when encouraging and including others in games and physical activities (AP, CA, FMS, RE, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Apply strategies to work cooperatively when participating in physical activities
Elaboration: Demonstrating turn-taking and sharing equipment when participating in cooperative learning activities and minor games (AP, FMS, RE)
